attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (36343u), with CRLF line terminators

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects suspicious UTF16 and Base64 encoded PowerShell code that starts with a $ sign and a single char variable
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects base64 encoded Powershell directives.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\moteBitField.bat"   ; CommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Csc.EXE Execution Form Potentially Suspicious Parent

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=E3CCD845830D4059A76521E095230549FC7FCB17,MD5=62192216CE5BA62C44297544C18A48C0,SHA256=34E102F9AD249B343099913CF4EEA2334DECFAF0529314DE256EEFE77D04212B,IMPHASH=E71FED45B53EFEB0043B037EB03A1D12; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\3qax4jjr.cmdline"; FileVersion=4.8.9032.0 built by: NET481REL1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts attempting to disable scheduled scanning and other parts of Windows Defender ATP or set default actions to allow.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: frack113, elhoim, Tim Shelton (fps, alias support), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\moteBitField.bat"   ; CommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level - PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "Set-ExecutionPolicy" cmdlet.

Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden
Detects keywords that could indicate clearing PowerShell history
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Ilyas Ochkov, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of known powershell cmdlets such as "Clear-EventLog" to clear the Windows event logs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems), Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values:
@{ScriptBlockText=function Initialize-Papaya {
    Hide-Banana
    Set-Pineapple
    Clear-Kiwi
    Disable-Lemon
    
    $coconut = [System.Text.Encoding]::UTF8
    $guava = [System.Convert]
    $global:apple.k1 = $coconut.GetString($guava::FromBase64String('U3lzdGVtLldpbmRvd3MuRm9ybXM='))
    $global:apple.k2 = $coconut.GetString($guava::FromBase64String('VW5zYWZlTmF0aXZlTWV0aG9kcw=='))
    $global:apple.k3 = [byte[]]@(71,101,116,77,111,100,117,108,101,72,97,110,100,108,101)
    $global:apple.k4 = [ [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=77fefc95-f0c3-4244-b230-5568e853e644; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potentially suspicious keywords that could indicate the use of a PowerShell exploitation framework
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Perez Diego (@darkquassar), Tuan Le (NCSGroup)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Hashes=SHA1=E3CCD845830D4059A76521E095230549FC7FCB17,MD5=62192216CE5BA62C44297544C18A48C0,SHA256=34E102F9AD249B343099913CF4EEA2334DECFAF0529314DE256EEFE77D04212B,IMPHASH=E71FED45B53EFEB0043B037EB03A1D12; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\3qax4jjr.cmdline"; FileVersion=4.8.9032.0 built by: NET481REL1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=%WINDIR%\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Image=C:\Windows\system32\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=%WINDIR%\syswow64\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Image=C:\Windows\syswow64\windowspowershell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

@{Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe  /K "C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\moteBitField.bat"   ; CommandLine=""C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe""  -noprofile -windowstyle hidden -ep bypass -Command ""iex([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString([Convert]::FromBase64String(' [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=Medium; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{TargetFilename=%TEMP%\wvwt3zev\wvwt3zev.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\3qax4jjr.cmdline}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.
Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.
